alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 4:41AM EDT until June 16 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... South Central Escambia County in northwestern Florida... * Until 700 AM CDT. * At 341 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated repeated rounds of thunderstorms producing torrential downpours over the warned area. Doppler radar indicates that between 2 and 3 inches of rain has fallen across much of the warned area and an addition 1 to 3 inches will be possible. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Foley, Orange Beach, Magnolia Springs, Summerdale, Perdido Beach, Elberta, Miflin, Josephine, Caswell, Perdido Bay, Marlow, River Park, Chanticleer, Clay City, Seaglades, Quinavista and Pleasant Grove. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
